messages.title: Please re-elect Mary Glindon on the 7th May
messages.content: I am standing for Parliament again, not just because I want to see a Labour Government elected on the 7th May, but because I want to be re-elected to represent the area that I come from and that I am passionate about and to be truly your voice in the House of Commons.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS, none of our manifesto commitments require additional borrowing.

We will freeze energy bills until 2017 and give the regulator the power to cut bills this winter. We will ban exploitative zero-hours contracts, raise the minimum wage to £8, and provide 25 hours free childcare for working parents with 3 and 4-year-olds.

We will build an NHS with the time to care: 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 more GPs. We will join up services from home to hospital and guarantee GP appointments within 48 hours and cancer tests within one week.

People who work long term on regular short-term contracts should have a right to a regular contract. We will help working people by making it illegal for employers to undercut wages by exploiting workers.
We will reduce tuition fees to £6,000, guarantee an apprenticeship for every school leaver who gets the basic grades, and ensure smaller class sizes for 5, 6, and 7-year-olds.

issues.economy: We will balance the books and cut the deficit every year while securing the future of the NHS, none of our manifesto commitments require additional borrowing.

contactInformation.address: 7 Palmersville, Forest Hall, Newcastle upon Tyne NE12 9HN

images.caption: Mary Glindon, Labour candidate for North Tyneside
